div1.p: Carter expresses her heartfelt thanks to Welch for his Memorandum for the International Health Board on Henry Rose Carter's death.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to William H. Welch, November 13, 1926
div1.p:
Dr. Frost, this morning, brought me the copy of the Memorandum on
Father's death, which you prepared for the minutes of the International
Health Board and which you kindly wrote him I might see.

Few things in my life have so touched and so completely satisfied
me. My one regret is that I cannot share with him so beautiful a tribute
from one “whose just and discriminating praise--generously given” he con-
sidered “in itself a decoration.”
There was no one of whom Father thought more highly than of yourself.

No one, save yourself, could--in so brief a space--have so com-
pletely brought him back to us.
To no one am I more grateful!
div1.closer:
Most truly yours, (Signed) Laura Armistead Carter. Biographic
Welch, Will
